The RCP climate simulations presented in the CMIP5 framework are derived from a distinct combination of economic, technological, land use, energy, demographic, and policy futures, which result from different levels of societal action that aim to prevent further changes in climate. Each of the four RCPs (RCP2.6, RCP4.5, RCP6.0, and RCP8.5) reflects a specific GHG emission trajectory and a corresponding radiative forcing starting in 2006 and culminating in 2100 ( Wayne 2013). The radiative forcing levels for the four RCPs range from 2.6W/m 2 to 8.5W/m 2 ( Masui et al. 2011; Riahi et al. 2011; Thomson et al. 2011; Van Vuuren et al. 2011). Each scenario is associated with different magnitudes of global surface temperature increase.
